rows.name: Object Properties

block1_text.eng:
Start off this group of shape talks by developing your students observational and descriptive skills.

Point them to an object, a group of objects, a picture, or a part of the place where they are, and ask them to describe some of the individual things they see.

rows.block1_text:
Start off this group of shape talks by developing your students observational and descriptive skills.

Point them to an object, a group of objects, a picture, or a part of the place where they are, and ask them to describe some of the individual things they see.

rows.name: Spatial Relationships

block1_text.eng: Extend your students skills of observation and description by having them consider how objects relate to each other in space.

rows.block1_text: Extend your students skills of observation and description by having them consider how objects relate to each other in space.

rows.name: Single Shapes

block1_text.eng: Use cards with images or of physical shapes (cut out of paper, made of wood, or whatever is handy). It is important that you do not always present the shapes in the same way. Vary them by rotating them or by using different sizes.

rows.block1_text: Use cards with images or of physical shapes (cut out of paper, made of wood, or whatever is handy). It is important that you do not always present the shapes in the same way. Vary them by rotating them or by using different sizes.

rows.name: Pairs of Shapes

block1_text.eng: Select two shapes, perhaps with an intentional goal in mind, or perhaps at random, and ask your students "How are these the same and how are they different?"

rows.block1_text: Select two shapes, perhaps with an intentional goal in mind, or perhaps at random, and ask your students "How are these the same and how are they different?"

rows.name: Shape Hunts

block1_text.eng:
Name or describe a shape and have your students find the item in their surroundings. As this gets easier, start adding extra conditions.
* Ask for two squares or three circles.
* Ask for a blue triangle
* Ask for a red square under a blue triangle

rows.block1_text:
Name or describe a shape and have your students find the item in their surroundings. As this gets easier, start adding extra conditions.
* Ask for two squares or three circles.
* Ask for a blue triangle
* Ask for a red square under a blue triangle

rows.name: Shape Groups

block1_text.eng:
Provide a group of shapes and ask questions about it.
* Are there any triangles?
* What is the name of the red shape?
* Which shape seems the most different from the others?

rows.block1_text:
Provide a group of shapes and ask questions about it.
* Are there any triangles?
* What is the name of the red shape?
* Which shape seems the most different from the others?

rows.name: Shape Sorting

block1_text.eng: Give your students a collection of cards or objects and have them sort them into groups that have a common characteristic.

rows.block1_text: Give your students a collection of cards or objects and have them sort them into groups that have a common characteristic.

rows.name: Make Scenes From Shapes

block1_text.eng: Give your students a large collection of shapes and challenge them to make a picture or scene of some sort. This may be a simple geometric request – make a hexagon – or it may get more involved and less specific, such as making a building.

rows.block1_text: Give your students a large collection of shapes and challenge them to make a picture or scene of some sort. This may be a simple geometric request – make a hexagon – or it may get more involved and less specific, such as making a building.
